message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper focuses on Commonsense Reading Comprehension (CRC), which is a task related to natural language processing and requires the use of machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper proposes a Multi-Perspective Fusion Network (MPFN) to improve the accuracy of CRC, which involves the use of artificial intelligence and deep learning techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The MPFN also involves the fusion of multiple perspectives, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper uses the MCScript dataset, which involves narrative passages and may require visual understanding, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category as well.
